meanings.definition: A Japanese martial art involving grappling and striking techniques.
meanings.sent1: He practiced jiujitsus with his friends after school.
meanings.sent2: The dojo offered classes in jiujitsus for all ages.
meanings.sent3: During the tournament, she used her jiujitsus skills to win the match.
meanings.sent4: His mind became a battlefield where different jiujitsus techniques fought for dominance.
meanings.sent5: The sensei's demonstration of jiujitsus left the audience in awe.

meanings.definition: The practice or study of jiujitsus.
meanings.sent1: Her dedication to jiujitsus training paid off in competitions.
meanings.sent2: The history of jiujitsus dates back centuries in Japan.
meanings.sent3: He found solace in the discipline of jiujitsus during tough times.
meanings.sent4: In the library, books on jiujitsus lined the shelves like ancient scrolls.
meanings.sent5: The art of jiujitsus required patience and perseverance to master.

meanings.definition: To engage in jiujitsus for self-defense or sport.
meanings.sent1: She jiujitsused her way out of a dangerous situation.
meanings.sent2: They jiujitsus regularly to stay fit and learn new skills.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he would jiujitsus his way through the obstacle course.
meanings.sent4: In life, sometimes you need to jiujitsus your problems head-on.
meanings.sent5: The team decided to jiujitsus their way to victory in the championship.
